text.p: Microsoft Corp introduced Sunday Microsoft Site Server, a new member of the its BackOffice software products built on the Windows network operating system and Internet Information Server.
Microsoft, the world's largest computer software company, made the announcement at its Solution Provider Conference here.
Microsoft said Site Server will make it easy to enhance, deploy and manage sophisticated intranet and Internet sites.

The product will be available in two editions and will be available this summer, it said. Pre-release versions of the software are scheduled to be available for downloading and evaluation in mid-May, it said.

Microsoft Site Server 2.0 will be available for approximately $1,499 and Microsoft Site Server, Enterprise Edition 2.0 will be available for approximately $4,999, it added. Additional commerce sites on a single server will be approximately $499 per site.
